intro: Sphaeroma berteroana, commonly known as the golden starflower, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae and is characterized by its striking yellow flowers that bloom in spring. The plant has a rhizomatous root system and produces small, oval-shaped leaves. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands and along stream banks. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardeners seeking vibrant, native plant species.
